p: The activity of polyphenols derived from Broussonetia papyrifera against 3-chymotrypsin-like and papain-like coronavirus cysteine proteases were discussed by Ji-Young Park et al. [ 50]. Many polyphenols were discovered to be more potent as inhibitors of papain-like protease (PL pro) than those of 3-chymotripsin-like protease (3CL pro) [ 50]. Among these polyphenols, papyriflavonol ( 22) ( Fig. 6 ) was discovered to manifest the most potent inhibitory activity against PL pro with an IC 50 value of 3.7 μM while C-5-alkyl group (prenyl)-substituted flavan ( 23) was the most potent against SARS- CoV 3CL pro which was proven to be more effective than quercetin derivative (IC 50 = 52.7 μM).
